events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim with basic accident details.
Based on the accident description and type of damage, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident for further processing.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the case, ensuring quicker and more efficient follow-up with the customer.
The claim was formally acknowledged, and the insured was informed that the investigation process would begin shortly.
The agent requested supporting documents including accident photos, police report, and vehicle registration papers.
The insured promptly submitted all requested documents, providing clear photos of vehicle damage and the official police report.
The insurance investigation team began reviewing all submitted evidence to determine fault and assess damages.
The investigation was completed with findings indicating the insured was not at fault, and damage estimates were finalized.
A fair settlement amount covering full repair costs was proposed to the insured based on the assessment.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the speed and transparency of the claim process and the proposed settlement.
The claim was approved by the claims manager following positive feedback and confirmation of settlement agreement.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the insuredâ€™s bank account successfully and on schedule.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance; the insured was notified, completing the claim cycle.
All case files and records were securely archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
